intro: Calycothrix luteola, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Calycothrix luteola is often cultivated for its vibrant color and ease of growth in garden settings.
